trans-unit.source: Sets the gamma ramp on direct color display boards that support downloadable gamma ramps in hardware

seg-source.mrk: Sets the gamma ramp on direct color display boards that support downloadable gamma ramps in hardware

target.mrk: Sets the gamma ramp on direct color display boards that support downloadable gamma ramps in hardware

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to a device context of the direct color display board in question.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to a device context of the direct color display board in question.

target.mrk: Handle to a device context of the direct color display board in question.

trans-unit.source: The 2D array ([r1, g1, b1], [r2, g2, b2], ... [r256, g256, b256]) that contains the gamma ramp to be set.

seg-source.mrk: The 2D array ([r1, g1, b1], [r2, g2, b2], ...
[r256, g256, b256]) that contains the gamma ramp to be set.

target.mrk: The 2D array ([r1, g1, b1], [r2, g2, b2], ...
[r256, g256, b256]) that contains the gamma ramp to be set.

trans-unit.source: Each element in this array is an integer value with a range from 0 to 65535 which is a mapping between

seg-source.mrk: Each element in this array is an integer value with a range from 0 to 65535 which is a mapping between

target.mrk: Each element in this array is an integer value with a range from 0 to 65535 which is a mapping between

trans-unit.source: RGB values in the frame buffer and digital-analog-converter (DAC) values. The RGB values must be stored

seg-source.mrk: RGB values in the frame buffer and digital-analog-converter (DAC) values.
The RGB values must be stored

target.mrk: RGB values in the frame buffer and digital-analog-converter (DAC) values.
The RGB values must be stored

trans-unit.source: in the most significant bits of each WORD to increase DAC independence.

seg-source.mrk: in the most significant bits of each WORD to increase DAC independence.

target.mrk: in the most significant bits of each WORD to increase DAC independence.

seg-source.mrk: False.

trans-unit.source: Direct color display modes do not use color lookup tables and are usually 16, 24, or 32 bit. Not all direct

Not all direct

Not all direct

trans-unit.source: color video boards support loadable gamma ramps. The _WinAPI_SetDeviceGammaRamp() succeeds only for devices

The _WinAPI_SetDeviceGammaRamp() succeeds only for devices

target.mrk: color video boards support loadable gamma ramps.
